review_blob: Oh dear oh dear oh dear. Locals seem obsessed with this desperately average ale. When working in a pub local to the Wye Valley, complaints went up if this was not available on tap, Its actually funny! Pours light brown golden with slight fizz, overpowering caramel flavours with off-bread notes. Light body with oily texture and a soft carbonation. Overall "little friend" (in English) is anything but, and Wye Valley offer so many better ales in my opinion.

beer_brewer_name: Socit Frigorifique et Brasserie de Tunis (SFBT)
review_blob: From a hotel in Tunisia. Relatively easy drinking with little flavour although very gassy. Seems to be the ONLY beer readily available in Tunisia and costs very little.
Pours medium dark brown from the cask with hardly any head. Floral hoppy notes with strong dark chocolate, cereals and toasty flavours, yet light finish.
